channel.title: Blog on JuliaGPU
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on JuliaGPU

item.title: CUDAnative 3.0 and CuArrays 2.0
item.description: This release of the Julia CUDA stack contains some exciting new features: automatic installation of CUDA using artifacts, full support for GPU method redefinitions, and experimental support for multitasking and multithreading. The release is technically breaking, but most end-users should not be affected. API changes Changes to certain APIs require these releases to be breaking, however, most users should not be affected and chances are you can just bump your Compat entries without any additional changes.

item.title: Julia's Dramatic Rise in HPC and Elsewhere
Accelerating Tensor Computations in Julia with the GPU
New website for JuliaGPU
item.description: Welcome to the new landing page for the JuliaGPU organization. This website serves as an introduction to the several packages for programming GPUs in Julia, with pointers to relevant resources for new users. The sources for this website are hosted at GitHub and generated using Hugo, feel free to open an issue or pull request if you think it could be improved.

item.title: DifferentialEquations.jl v6.9.0 released with automatic Multi-GPU support
Julia Computing Brings Support for NVIDIA GPU Computing on Arm Powered Servers
An Introduction to GPU Programming in Julia
DifferentialEquations.jl v6.4.0 released with full GPU ODE support

New Climate Model to be Built from the Ground Up
